fields.name: target
fields.description: Object being edited - null if creating a new object

fields.name: merge_sources
fields.description: Objects to merge with the target. Only applicable to merges

fields.name: old_details
fields.description: Previous state of fields being modified - null if operation is create or delete.

fields.name: options
fields.description: Entity specific options

fields.name: vote_count
fields.description: = Accepted - Rejected

fields.name: destructive
fields.description: Is the edit considered destructive.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Not required for create type

inputFields.name: merge_source_ids
inputFields.description: Only required for merge type

inputFields.name: bot
inputFields.description: Edit submitted by an automated script. Requires bot permission

inputFields.name: user_id
inputFields.description: Filter by user id

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description: Filter by status

inputFields.name: operation
inputFields.description: Filter by operation

inputFields.name: vote_count
inputFields.description: Filter by vote count

inputFields.name: applied
inputFields.description: Filter by applied status

inputFields.name: target_type
inputFields.description: Filter by target type

inputFields.name: target_id
inputFields.description: Filter by target id

inputFields.name: is_favorite
inputFields.description: Filter by favorite status

inputFields.name: voted
inputFields.description: Filter by user voted status

inputFields.name: is_bot
inputFields.description: Filter to bot edits only

inputFields.name: include_user_submitted
inputFields.description: Filter out user's own edits

fields.name: submissions
fields.description: number of times this fingerprint has been submitted (excluding reports)

fields.name: reports
fields.description: number of times this fingerprint has been reported

fields.name: user_submitted
fields.description: true if the current user submitted this fingerprint

fields.name: user_reported
fields.description: true if the current user reported this fingerprint

inputFields.name: user_ids
inputFields.description: assumes current user if omitted. Ignored for non-modify Users

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: newUser
fields.description: User interface for registering

fields.name: generateInviteCodes
fields.description: Generates an invite code using an invite token

fields.name: rescindInviteCode
fields.description: Removes a pending invite code - refunding the token

fields.name: grantInvite
fields.description: Adds invite tokens for a user

fields.name: revokeInvite
fields.description: Removes invite tokens from a user

fields.name: regenerateAPIKey
fields.description: Regenerates the api key for the given user, or the current user if id not provided

fields.name: resetPassword
fields.description: Generates an email to reset a user password

fields.name: changePassword
fields.description: Changes the password for the current user

fields.name: requestChangeEmail
fields.description: Request an email change for the current user

fields.name: sceneEdit
fields.description: Propose a new scene or modification to a scene

fields.name: performerEdit
fields.description: Propose a new performer or modification to a performer

fields.name: studioEdit
fields.description: Propose a new studio or modification to a studio

fields.name: tagEdit
fields.description: Propose a new tag or modification to a tag

fields.description: Update a pending scene edit

fields.description: Update a pending performer edit

fields.name: studioEditUpdate

fields.name: tagEditUpdate
fields.description: Update a pending tag edit

fields.name: applyEdit

fields.name: cancelEdit

fields.name: submitFingerprint
fields.description: Matches/unmatches a scene to fingerprint

fields.name: submitSceneDraft
fields.description: Draft submissions

fields.name: favoriteStudio
fields.description: Favorite or unfavorite a studio

fields.description: Mark all of the current users notifications as read.

fields.name: updateNotificationSubscriptions
fields.description: Update notification subscriptions for current user.

fields.name: height
fields.description: Height in cm

fields.name: merged_into_id
fields.description: ID of performer that replaces this one

fields.name: as
fields.description: Performing as alias

fields.name: height
fields.description: Height in cm

inputFields.name: options
inputFields.description: Controls aliases modification for merges and name modifications

fields.name: set_modify_aliases
fields.description: Set performer alias on scenes without alias to old name if name is changed

fields.name: set_merge_aliases
fields.description: Set performer alias on scenes attached to merge sources to old name

inputFields.description: Set performer alias on scenes without alias to old name if name is changed

types.name: Query
types.description: The query root for this schema

fields.name: findPerformer

fields.name: findUser
fields.description: Find user by ID or username

fields.name: me
fields.description: Returns currently authenticated user

types.description: The `String`scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

enumValues.name: IMMEDIATE_ACCEPT
enumValues.description: Immediately accepts the edit - bypassing the vote

enumValues.name: IMMEDIATE_REJECT
enumValues.description: Immediately rejects the edit - bypassing the vote

directives.name: defer
directives.description: The @defer directive may be specified on a fragment spread to imply de-prioritization, that causes the fragment to be omitted in the initial response, and delivered as a subsequent response afterward. A query with @defer directive will cause the request to potentially return multiple responses, where non-deferred data is delivered in the initial response and data deferred delivered in a subsequent response. @include and @skip take precedence over @defer.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: The @deprecated built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate deprecated portions of a GraphQL service's schema, such as deprecated fields on a type, arguments on a field, input fields on an input type, or values of an enum type.

directives.name: include
directives.description: The @include directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional inclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: The @skip directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional exclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: The @specifiedBy built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to provide a scalar specification URL for specifying the behavior of custom scalar types.
